critique: The document is an amendment to an executive order related to the Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC) from 1937. It primarily focuses on inter-agency cooperation, specifically requesting the Secretaries of War, Interior, Agriculture, Labor, and the Administrator of Veterans' Affairs to cooperate with the Director of the CCC. The amendment itself doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most scores will be neutral. The only exception might be a slight lean towards federalism, as it reinforces the role of federal agencies in a national program.
